meanings.definition: To free someone from a misconception or error.
meanings.sent1: She disabuses her friend of the idea that cats are afraid of water.
meanings.sent2: The teacher disabuses the students of the myth that lightning never strikes the same place twice.
meanings.sent3: The magician disabuses the audience of the belief that he can make a rabbit disappear with magic.
meanings.sent4: His research disabuses the notion that all birds migrate south for the winter.
meanings.sent5: The documentary disabuses viewers of the misconception that sharks are mindless killing machines.

meanings.sent1: He disabuses his sister of the idea that eating watermelon seeds will make a watermelon grow in her stomach.
meanings.sent2: The scientist disabuses the public of the misconception that vaccines cause autism.
meanings.sent3: The comedian disabuses the audience of the hilarious notion that eating ice cream makes you lose weight.
meanings.sent4: Her experience disabuses the belief that all politicians are corrupt.
meanings.sent5: The book disabuses readers of the false idea that all spiders are dangerous.
